cars.title: 2023 Tesla Model S
cars.description: The Tesla Model S is a full-size luxury sedan manufactured and marketed by Tesla, Inc. It is the company's second model, after the Roadster. The Model S was launched in June 2008 and reached production in June 2012, making it the first zero-emission luxury sedan to enter mass production.

cars.title: 2024 Ford Mustang Mach-E
cars.description: The Ford Mustang Mach-E is a battery-electric SUV manufactured and marketed by Ford Motor Company. It is the first fully electric vehicle in the iconic Ford Mustang lineage, which dates back to the 1960s. The Mach-E was unveiled at the 2020 Los Angeles Auto Show and entered production in 2022.

cars.title: 2023 Chevrolet Bolt EV
cars.description: The Chevrolet Bolt EV is a battery-electric compact car produced by General Motors. It was first released in 2016, and was the first mass-market battery-electric car to be sold in the United States. The Chevrolet Bolt EV is powered by a 113 kWh battery, which is capable of driving the car approximately 250 miles on a single charge.

cars.title: 2023 Hyundai Kona Electric
cars.description: The Hyundai Kona Electric is a battery-electric subcompact crossover produced by Hyundai Motor Company. It was first released in 2019, and is the first mass-market electric vehicle produced by Hyundai. The Hyundai Kona Electric is powered by a 70 kWh battery, which is capable of driving the car approximately 220 miles on a single charge.

cars.title: 2024 Nissan Leaf
cars.description: The Nissan Leaf is a battery-electric compact car produced by Nissan. It was first released in 2010, and is the first mass-market battery-electric car to be sold in the United States. The Nissan Leaf is powered by a 50 kWh battery, which is capable of driving the car approximately 240 miles on a single charge.

cars.title: 2025 Volkswagen ID.4
cars.description: The Volkswagen ID.4 is a battery-electric compact car produced by Volkswagen Group. It was first released in 2020, and is the first mass-market electric vehicle produced by Volkswagen. The Volkswagen ID.4 is powered by a 90 kWh battery, which is capable of driving the car approximately 250 miles on a single charge.

cars.title: 2026 Audi e-tron
cars.description: The Audi e-tron is a battery-electric compact car produced by Audi. It was first released in 2020, and is the first mass-market battery-electric car produced by Audi. The Audi e-tron is powered by a 80 kWh battery, which is capable of driving the car approximately 250 miles on a single charge.

cars.title: 2027 BMW iX3
cars.description: The BMW iX3 is a battery-electric compact SUV produced by BMW. It was first released in 2020, and is the first mass-market battery-electric SUV produced by BMW. The BMW iX3 is powered by a 60 kWh battery, which is capable of driving the car approximately 220 miles on a single charge.

cars.title: 2028 Honda Clarity
cars.description: The Honda Clarity is a battery-electric compact car produced by Honda. It was first released in 2020, and is the first mass-market battery-electric car produced by Honda. The Honda Clarity is powered by a 55 kWh battery, which is capable of driving the car approximately 240 miles on a single charge.

cars.title: 2029 Kia eSoul
cars.description: The Kia eSoul is a battery-electric compact car produced by Kia. It was first released in 2020, and is the first mass-market battery-electric car produced by Kia. The Kia eSoul is powered by a 55 kWh battery, which is capable of driving the car approximately 240 miles on a single charge.

cars.title: 2030 Nissan Leaf
cars.description: The Nissan Leaf is a battery-electric compact car produced by Nissan. It was first released in 2010, and is the first mass-market battery-electric car produced by Nissan. The Nissan Leaf is powered by a 50 kWh battery, which is capable of driving the car approximately 220 miles on a single charge.

cars.title: 2031 Chevrolet Bolt
cars.description: The Chevrolet Bolt is a battery-electric compact car produced by Chevrolet. It was first released in 2017, and is the first mass-market battery-electric car produced by Chevrolet. The Chevrolet Bolt is powered by a 60 kWh battery, which is capable of driving the car approximately 250 miles on a single charge.

cars.title: 2032 Ford Focus Electric
cars.description: The Ford Focus Electric is a battery-electric compact car produced by Ford. It was first released in 2012, and is the first mass-market electric vehicle produced by Ford. The Ford Focus Electric is powered by a 40 kWh battery, which is capable of driving the car approximately 240 miles on a single charge.

cars.title: 2033 Volkswagen ID. Buzz
cars.description: The Volkswagen ID. Buzz is a battery-electric microcar produced by Volkswagen Group. It was first released in 2020, and is the first mass-market battery-electric microcar produced by Volkswagen. The Volkswagen ID. Buzz is powered by a 20 kWh battery, which is capable of driving the car approximately 100 miles on a single charge.

cars.title: 2034 Tesla Model Y
cars.description: The Tesla Model Y is a battery-electric minivan produced by Tesla, Inc. It was first released in 2022, and is the first mass-market battery-electric minivan produced by Tesla. The Tesla Model Y is powered by a 100 kWh battery, which is capable of driving the car approximately 300 miles on a single charge.
